turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: You stretch out. I'll fix something to eat.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Thanks, Steve.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: You don't know what it is to be sorry.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Steve --

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Goodnight, Miss Wells.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: If you need me, I'll be --

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yeah, I'm fine. I just broke up with my boyfriend, that's all.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: That's always tough. How long were you together?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Well, we never made it official, so I guess we were technically never really boyfriend and girlfriend, but I was seeing him in school. I saw him at the mall about six months ago and I was too nervous to introduce myself so I followed him to his car, and jotted down the license plate number. It was registered to his mother, so I went to her house. She was so nice. I mean, she seemed like she would be nice 'cuz I never really spoke to her. I just waited til she went to work then I climbed in through her window and borrowed her phone book. I say borrowed because I'm going to give it back one day. But anyway, I called everyone in it til I found her son. He wasn't home when I called so I left this message how much in love I was with him. I was, and how I wanted to have his children. Just really opening up, and he never called back. I'd call and call, and anyway, six months and two restraining orders later I just decided I deserved better. What about you? Do you have a boyfriend?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: No, I haven't dated in a while. My last boyfriend's...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Brenda was right. There's more to the story than the Professor told us. I found a secret room. It had all these news clippings about Hugh Kane. He was a very evil man.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Ah, they just don't know you the way I do.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I found a picture of his wife.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Wife?!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Oh, he was a widower. Why didn't you say that?...  Don't worry, sweetie, I can whip up a new batch in a flash.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I think he wants me.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Ha! Right bitch!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No, I won't let you do it.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Alex, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Shut up, you slut. You think you can take him from me? Well, over my dead body.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Hey, Brenda.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Well, actually, we've never met officially, but I bumped into you at the cafeteria and you were so sweet. I said, "I'm sorry," and you said, "Watch it, white bitch, or I'll put my size eight in your ass." I thought how cool. I wear a size eight, too. Anyway, this is my best friend, Cindy.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Me, too. 101?

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: In room "302" at ten o'clock?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Oh, this is too much. I'm gonna have to play these numbers. Remind me to pick up a Lotto ticket.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: And remember that trip we took to Africa? That safari was so wonderful. Me, you... best of friends... forever.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Uh, Alex, we've only know each other one day.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Oh... I guess I'll die now.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Okay... maybe that would be best.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Oh, remember that time I got my training bra and you --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Never happened!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: My favorite memory was when we --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Would you die already?!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: We already know each other. Hey, Brenda.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Hey, Cindy. Your friend needs help.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Actually, I just met her. This is Alex.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Oh my god. Madam Elsa, my psychic, told me I would meet somebody whose name starts with a letter of the alphabet today.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Really? That's amazing.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Hey girl, that jacket is slamming.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: You better be careful. I heard some girl got her ass whooped and jacket stolen earlier today.  Hey, what class do we have next?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Psychology.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Ouch!!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Brenda, are you okay? Come sit.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: No, you don't understand. It's here in these statues...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Help!

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Now, why that bitch gotta bring that shit this way? I hope she didn't see me.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh my God! We're dead!

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: It would've just been you, if you would've kept your mouth shut.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: It's coming!

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: What?! What is it, a monster?!

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Hey, look, I'm Wilma Flintstone.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Hey, I have an idea...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh my God, the ghost has Buddy! Brenda do something!

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Cindy, what's going on?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: It's Hanson, he's evil. Let's get him!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: This house was built in 1898 by a man named Archibald Keaton as a gift to his wife, Cora.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Yes, I feel their spirits. Cora... Keaton... I am here to communicate...

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: No, they sold the house in 1920 to a millionaire, Uriah Bloodworth.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Yes, of course, Uriah. I feel his evil presence.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: No, he lost the house after the stock market crash.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: But he could still be haunting the house. He's angry that he had to leave.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: He's not dead, you idiot. He lives in Florida. Now, shut up and let me finish.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hello Brenda.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Hello Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Shhh... It's okay.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Ray, have you been here all this time?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I just wanted to make sure you were okay.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: I'm fine. Just a few bruises.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: So, I guess I can go now.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: No, stay.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Yeah, I think I'll feel better sleeping in the arms of a strong man.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, me too.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Are you okay? I thought I heard screaming.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Oh, I'm fine... just clowning around.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He's right. I should go first.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: He's so brave.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Where's Shorty?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't know. He was right behind us. Wait here. I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Ray, run faster.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Hey, you left your book back there.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Thanks. I'm Cindy.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: So, I see you're really into spooks.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: No. I never date outside my race.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I meant you're into ghosts.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh, yeah. I'm just curious about that kind of stuff.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: So it looks like we're going to be spending the weekend together.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Maybe we can study together or something.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I'm sorry, Buddy. You seem really nice, but I'm just getting over a really bad relationship, and I'm not ready to start dating yet.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: But, hey, maybe we can be friends.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Sure, that would be cool. Friends.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Okay. See you later, friend.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Hi Buddy.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Open chest!!!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: You know, Buddy, about this friendship thing...

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Yeah, it's great, isn't it. I think it's so cool... have a girl as a friend.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: That's just it, Buddy. I'm a girl. You can't be so rough with me.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Then what kinda stuff can we do?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Gentle stuff like talking, sharing thoughts and ideas, secrets and past experiences. Stuff like that, you know.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: It sounds gay, but guess since you're a girl it's okay, huh?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Yeah, it will be fine. I wanna check something out. Will you come with me?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Sure. We can practice talking.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Buddy...

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Wait, I'm just about to tell you the best part.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Dude, somebody's on the rag.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Shhh!

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Whoa, check this out. She looks like you.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Wow, she's beautiful. You really think she looks like me?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Her hair doesn't have as many split ends at yours. Her skin isn't as oily as yours, either. Also, sometimes your eyes get kinda squinty and they look like you might have Down's Syndrome or something. Otherwise the resemblance is uncanny.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Oh yeah... another difference is she looks more sophisticated and classy. More feminine. And her tits are perfect. Not pointy and funny looking, or spaced too far apart...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Alright!

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Where the hell are we?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: It looks like the furnace.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Let's get outta here.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Wait, I want to check something. Give me a hand.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Well, if that's Hanson, then who's the guy with the hand?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Hugh Kane.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Yeah, I think I'm bleeding.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Come on. There's a first aid kit in the lab.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Cindy, I've been thinking about this whole friend thing. I never had a friend that cares for me the way you do... I mean, there's Ray, but he cares for me in a different way. You know, bringing me flowers. Running my bath water. And then there's nights I wake up screaming and I look over and Ray's in my bed. Holding me. And seeing that tonight might be our last night together, I was thinking...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: That we should take our friendship a little further?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh, Buddy, I was thinking the same thing. It might be our last night in this house. And I think we should take full advantage of it.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I was thinking the same thing.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: We should act out our inner most fantasies.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Great!!!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Like, I've always wanted to walk on the moon.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: What about you, Buddy?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Well, I was hoping to get my balls licked.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: He's here.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: What are we gonna do? I'm cold. I can't move, I'm so cold.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Can you feel that?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: No. Try a little higher.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Feel that?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: No. Keep rubbing.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Better try a little higher.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Now, come on -- you know I'm not ready for that kind of --

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Cindy, please! It's a matter of life and death. I'm asking you a friend.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Well... okay... but only as a friend.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Cindy, let me...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: No, Buddy, I'm the one he wants.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Actually, I was going to say let me have your computer if you die.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: There's something I really want to share with you.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: There's something I want to share with you too. Here, smell this.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Cindy, about this whole friendship thing...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Yeah, I know, I just love having a guy for a friend.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I know, but I've been thinking --

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I know, but I've been thinking --

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Listen to me I --

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Listen to me I --

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Look, what I'm trying to say --

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Look, what I'm trying to say --

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Stop it! I'm just trying to say I think we should take our friendship to the next level.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I don't want to be your friend like this anymore.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Then what are we going to do?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You know, walking on the beach, holding hands, kissing, making love...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: That sounds kinda gay, but since you're a guy, I guess it's okay.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Let's get a hot dog.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Hey, look out, a bee!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh, Buddy, I've never had someone be so protective of me!

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: That's what your man is supposed to do.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Hey, wanna' share a soda?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh, Buddy, that's so romantic.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Yeah.  Can I borrow five bucks?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: What should we get?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I don't care. You pick.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Hot dogs.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Come on. We better get you cleaned up.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No, I just heard the commotion, and when I got there I guess it was gone.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: What, you think I did this to myself?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Good-night, Cin. I'll be next door if you need me.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Thanks, I'll be fine.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Okay, I get the point.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: So, whatever happened to her?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: She killed herself a week before he died.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Let her go, Cin.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: But he'll kill her!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That means more screen time for us.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I'm sorry, I should have been watching where I...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh, my God, Ray! What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's the sequel.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh, right.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Listen, no need for you to worry. All that stuff that happened before is behind us. Let's just try to move on.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I am. So just do me a favor and stay away from me.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: How about these buns?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, they're so warm and soft.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Come in somebody. Can you hear me?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: This is Ray. What's up? Where are you?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: The ghost is close. He almost got us. Buddy is hurt.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What's your location? I repeat, what's your location?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Right behind you.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Where's Shorty?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't know. He was right behind me a minute ago.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Ray, you saved my life. Are you okay?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, I broke my fall.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh my God! I'm here with the...

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Yes, Professor Oldman's group. Forgive me. I didn't mean to frighten you.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I'm Cindy.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: I'm Hanson the caretaker.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Ummm!! They smell delicious.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Thanks. I made them by hand.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Morphine? chloroform? Horse tranquilizers? You've drugged him!

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: No, actually, I found him like this. That's his stuff.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Hanson, please.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Don't worry Cindy, the brain itself feels no pain.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Stop touching his brain!

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Um, I'm not touching anything.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Tell me, Cindy. Would you ever tell me "Stop. If you loved me you'd stop."

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Not in a thousand years.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Stop! --

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Made you say it!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: It was you...

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Yes, it was me all along. I killed Hugh Kane and his mistress.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Both of them?

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Didn't I just say that? Fucking listen. Anyway, I did it all for Carolyn. He never appreciated her, but I worshipped that woman and still she rejected me. So, I came back for you. Just like I did for Carolyn.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: This can't be happening?

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Now you'll be mine, Cindy.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Noooo!!!

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Yes!!!!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Would you like me to help you pass them back?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: I don't need your help.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Just wait, you'll see.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: He won't let us go. He's going to kill us.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Quick, everyone to the lab.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: What are we gonna do?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: We have to destroy him.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Someone is going to have to lure him onto the platform.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I'll go.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Cool, but remember, as soon as he gets on the platform you gotta get out of there.  Nobody wants to go.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Alright, let's take a vote...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Father!

turns.speaker: MCFEELY
turns.text: My child, you're alive!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Yes, we made it!

turns.speaker: MCFEELY
turns.text: We? What do you mean... we?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Me and my friends... You see there was this ghost. He came out of nowhere and....

turns.speaker: MCFEELY
turns.text: My child you are the only survivor.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: No, my friends are right here!

turns.speaker: MCFEELY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Father, I don't understand. Tell me what happened?

turns.speaker: MCFEELY
turns.text: Soon, but first I must bless this house.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: So, do you think you made it into the class?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: I don't know, but I sure hope so.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: You could use the grade, huh?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Nah, I need a place to stay. So how do you like being in college?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Okay, I guess. It's so intimidating. You know being away from home, not knowing anyone. I feel like such a geek sometimes. Everyone's so cool and I'm so not.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Aww, you ain't that bad. You just need a little flava. First thing we gotta do is get you some new gear.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Gear. You know, clothing.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Let's start with some rhythm. Sway back and forth like this.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Left, right, left, right, crossover kick...

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Now you gotta learn the correct slang.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Yo! That jacket is tight.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Yeah, now go uhn, uhn, uhn!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Uhn! Uhn! Uhn!

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Yeah, you feel that? Now put it all together.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Am I cool now?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Almost... Look, I gotta bounce. I'll holla at you later.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Aww, the little bird died.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Yeah, I didn't know what else to do.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Hey, I got an idea.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: That was a great idea, Shorty.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: I told you it would taste just like chicken.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Did you do that?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Uh, uh.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: You better go get Dwight and the Professor.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: She'd have to be really pretty and I'd have to be very drunk.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: I'm going to work in Washington, Cindy.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Are you?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: That's where my best customers are. Marion Berry, George Bush, the Redskins. I'd like to offer you a job, Cindy. Can you type? Take dictation? Swallow balloons filled with cocaine?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Hey, y'all! What's going on?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Shorty! You're alive!! But... what about your head?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: That turned out to be a good thing! It's gonna make smuggling a whole lot easier. Remember that weed? I'm about to get paid.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Professor, is this the same house that a young girl was possessed by a demon or something?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Yes, it was reported, but never substantiated.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Professor, what's the history of this house?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: I'm glad you asked. It actually makes for a pretty good bedtime story.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Alright, Cindy, what's so important?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Professor, you guys gotta see this. Dwight, come here.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Yippie! Wasn't that amazing?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: It's some kind of energy field. We better record this.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Got my camera right here.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I got it!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: That's fantastic. Our first phenomenon. This is going to be a great weekend. You guys better get some sleep. Dwight and I will take over from here.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I'm telling you, it was possessed.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Theo, did you see the animal?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: No, I'm just saying cats are known to be very territorial animals, and it is likely it did attack, but it doesn't mean it was possessed. Maybe the two of you should sleep together.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: What are you getting at, Professor?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Only that if this cat did attack, he's less likely to come back if the two of you were, let's say, together. Come on, it's college. Time for you two to experiment.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Good idea, and don't forget to give her a good-night kiss.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: There's something going on in this house. I'm not crazy.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Got a problem with that?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Yeah, bitch, give me my apple. What's gotten into you?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: I take it you're not mad at me.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I wouldn't go that far.
